Summary: Create clear sections so the UI feels cohesive.
Details Key Points: Define 4 to 5 sections only, Move sliders into correct groups (e.g., Source, Geometry, Animation, Color and Brightness, Output and View).
Acceptance Criteria: All sliders are grouped under a minimal number of clear headers.

Issue Title: Add “Advanced” toggle to hide secondary controls
Summary: Reduce visual clutter and complexity on the default screen.
Details Key Points: Add toggle labeled “Advanced”, When off, hide secondary parameters, Core sliders always visible.
Acceptance Criteria: Default view shows only essential controls.

Summary: Users mostly interact with a small number of sliders.
Details Key Points: Identify 6 to 10 most used sliders, Label them as “Core”, Consider a small visual indicator.
Acceptance Criteria: Core controls are visually distinct and easy to find.

Issue Title: Add Reset button to main UI
Summary: Reset is currently only in a menu.
Details Key Points: Add button near the slider area, One-click reset to default values.
Acceptance Criteria: User can reset without opening menus.

Details Key Points: Add toggle to UI, Add keyboard shortcut (ex: F or Alt Enter), Fullscreen hides UI.
Acceptance Criteria: User can enter and exit fullscreen easily.

Summary: Allow saving and loading of settings.
Details Key Points: Save current UI state as JSON, Load JSON to restore settings, Store files in a presets directory.
Acceptance Criteria: Presets can be saved, loaded, and deleted.

Details Key Points: List existing presets, Buttons: Save, Load, Delete, Minimal styling.
Acceptance Criteria: User can manage presets from within the app.

Summary: Restore state automatically when app restarts.
Details Key Points: Save state before exit, Load state on startup.
Acceptance Criteria: The app opens with the previous settings intact.

Summary: Demonstrate possible uses of the app.
Details Key Points: Include built-in presets (e.g., Soft Mirror, Portal Tunnel, Dream Blur, VHS Ghost, Kaleido Bloom).
Acceptance Criteria: App ships with a set of sample presets.

Summary: Hide UI after inactivity or on command.
Details Key Points: Trigger after X seconds, Or menu: “Start Ambient Mode”, UI fades out.
Acceptance Criteria: App can run as an ambient visual on a monitor.

Details Key Points: Time slider for duration, Crossfade if possible, Loop through presets.
Acceptance Criteria: App cycles between presets hands-free.

Summary: Choose which display to use for output.
Details Key Points: Detect displays, Dropdown to select, Fullscreen renders on that display.
Acceptance Criteria: User can direct output to any connected monitor.

Details Key Points: Brainstorm 10 to 20 name options, Evaluate vibe and availability, Select one.
Acceptance Criteria: App has a new name direction.

Details Key Points: Draw or design a logo, Use during startup and in UI.
Acceptance Criteria: App has a branded logo and splash.

Details Key Points: Create .ico file, Bundle into build.
Acceptance Criteria: Taskbar and installer show custom icon.

Issue Title: Dark theme pass with consistent styling
Details Key Points: Align colors, fonts, UI elements, Hover and active states.
Acceptance Criteria: UI feels polished and intentional.

Details Key Points: Button: “Save Frame”, Save PNG to exports folder.
Acceptance Criteria: User can export screen stills.

Details Key Points: Render a frame at 2x or 4x resolution, Save PNG.
Acceptance Criteria: User can export high-quality stills.

Details Key Points: Tween parameters over 250 to 1000 ms, Try easing functions.
Acceptance Criteria: Transitions feel smooth.

Details Key Points: Low, Medium, High, Adjust internal resolution.
Acceptance Criteria: Option available if needed.
